description: Agaricus subrufescens is one of the most intensively researched medicinal mushrooms with the highest known concentration of beta-glucans among medicinal mushrooms. It is traditionally used in Brazil, Japan and the USA for immunostimulating and antitumoral applications.

traditional_medicine.historical_use: In the Brazilian rainforests, it was observed that the local population who regularly consumed this mushroom had virtually no cancer cases. This led to intensive scientific research.

clinical_indications.description: Supportive treatment for leukemia, prostate cancer, lung cancer, liver cancer, sarcomas
Stimulation of the immune system, activation of NK cells
Liver protection, detoxification in toxic liver diseases

mechanism_of_action: Beta-glucans bind to Dectin-1 and CR3 receptors on immune cells
Activation of macrophages and natural killer cells
Induction of apoptosis in cancer cells
Inhibition of angiogenesis in tumors (metastasis prevention)
Promotion of blood formation in bone marrow

dosage_general.description: Typical daily dose as dry extract or powder

side_effects.description: Very rare: allergic reactions in sensitive individuals

safety_in_pregnancy_note: Insufficient data. Use during pregnancy and breastfeeding not recommended.

clinical_studies.title: Antitumor activity of Agaricus blazei
clinical_studies.conclusion: Significant immunostimulating and antitumoral effect demonstrated

clinical_studies.title: Anti-tumor effects of Agaricus blazei
clinical_studies.conclusion: Beta-glucans show selective cytotoxicity on tumor cells

regulatory_note: Classified as food supplement in most countries
